pages.text: Vivaxosaurus is a dicynodont from the late Permian of Russia. It lived alongside animals like Scutosaurus, Dvinia and the apex predator, Inostrancevia. It had a robust body and it had two tusks in its mouth. Other than the tusks, it was completely toothless, instead it had a beak which it would break up vegetation with.
